title: Helping bronze improve.

embed.description: This is part of a series, where I try and help others go from Bronze to silver. Heck maybe even gold. Im not the one playing, Im spectating a game. If your bronze and want some help? Let me know.

body:
I decided to do this, as to TRY and help some bronze players improve.

Basically, I live commentate on what I feel like you should have done, should you ward, should you not face check every bush.
Items etc, If you are bronze and want some help.
Let me know, maybe I can.

Anyway, I hope you guys enjoy this, as Im gonna try and do more of this.
And talking for ages is hard :(

Oh, and let me know what I can do better, as I am new to this.

replies.body:
Totally off topic, but may i ask.

What video editing software are you using?

Im not even editing anything, but I could if I bothered with it.
Im using Adobe After effects, I recorded using Fraps.

Also, your video is in 4:3. Is it that way because of your monitors resolution? - You should definitely look into getting it into 16:9 as this makes your videos look more "professional" and "up to date".

This is the new vid, if you would like a look.
https://youtu.be/dIvyZFgScb4

Its in 16:9 and not 4:3.
Since you suggested it, Ive decided to give it a shot.
If you do look, please tell me if its better then the others.

Your 16:9 video looks a little "stretched". I also noticed your 16:9 video is in 420p, opposed to your 720p in your 4:3 video. I would not lose quality to get your video in 16:9. Ill take it that your video is like this because your not recording at a native 16:9 resolution. If you have a Nvidia graphics card you can get around this via upscaling but that still isn't perfect. For at least making videos i would go back to 4:3 until you can get your 16:9 videos to a higher resolution and without that stretched look. 
However, I've been really only talking about the negatives, so here is a few positives. Your audio quality is very high and your commentary is interesting to listen to. Your gameplay is also very interesting to watch. 

Sorry for the late reply, I've been busy over the last couple of days. 

-GL,HF

Yeah, I don't know what happened with that.
Usually everything I do is in 720P plus, and yeah I don't like it being stretched.

I've giving it a test, but I think Ill just go with the 4:3 visuals and have the small black boarders on the side as it wont look stretched.

And the late reply is fine, and thank you? I guess.
I need to get better at talking how ever, as I lack alot of things but I wanna get better.

Yeah it is because of the Monitors. 
I have two of them and both are different sizes, so I will look into this extra effort into making them from 4:3 to 16:9.

Thank you.

So end of season, I decide to check the boards, and I see this thread, bumped from 3 years ago. What a coincidence!
I am the MF in the video, and I am still playing MF now. Not quite getting Gold yet.

The part that confused me at the start was "Kindred's the only one who can shred tanks"

while looking at a lane with Vayne

Malph is armour based, not HP, right? So I'm pretty sure Kindred's useless against armour based tanks
You could make it more concise or bundle together a bunch of examples of similar mistakes in a single vid

mmm, the one thing I like to do is bring up the issues as they arise, Its also very hard to make it smaller. And If I cut out all the fuck ups, I wont be able to praise them for the good jobs that they actually do.

Thanks, I'll remember to keep most of this in mind next time I'm playing a game.

Question: If you're support and your team ignores scuttle/Kindred marks, should you take them or not? Technically, support should not take farm, but they're important to denying the enemy gold, XP, and, stats for Kindred
